Case Study.study_objective: To evaluate a leading brand’s image for its facial cleansing soap.
Case Study.summary: This qualitative study explored perceptions of a leading facial cleansing soap among women aged 18 to 34 in Delhi and Lucknow. Using face-to-face interviews and Central Location Tests, the research assessed whether the product is rich in moisturizers and was considered an effective cleanser. Respondents, selected from Living Standards Measure 5 to 10 and frequent bar-soap users, discussed overall product experience, cleansing quality, and brand impressions. While findings are confidential, the study provided clear direction on consumer expectations, product positioning, and areas requiring enhancement for improved acceptance.
Case Study.tags: facial cleansing, skincare, FMCG, qualitative, consumer insights, CLT, brand image, F2F, India
Case Study.business_impact: Helps strengthen product positioning, refine messaging, and identify improvement areas in cleansing performance and brand perception.

Case Study.study_objective: To understand the consumer usage behavior of Muesli Bar products.
Case Study.summary: This quantitative study explores Muesli Bar consumption patterns in Germany using the client’s online panel of active grocery shoppers who purchased Muesli bars in the last six months. The research examines market sizing, concept evaluation, and purchase intent for new flavour variants. It highlights consumer engagement with the category, key drivers influencing trial and repeat purchase, and segment-level differences. Challenges included managing household composition and social class weighting, as well as creating separate tab plans for multiple concepts. The findings offer strong direction for product portfolio expansion and targeted marketing decisions.
Case Study.tags: muesli bars, FMCG, Germany, online survey, consumption behaviour, concept testing, market sizing, quantitative
Case Study.business_impact: Supports product portfolio expansion by identifying demand potential, validating new concepts, and guiding targeted category strategies.

Case Study.study_objective: To understand consumer usage behaviour for Ice Cream Bars.
Case Study.summary: This quantitative study examined Ice Cream Bar consumption patterns in France using an online panel of grocery shoppers who had purchased the product in the past six months. It evaluated market receptiveness to new flavours, consumer liking across demographic segments, and purchase intention for proposed product variants. Respondents also shared preferences related to flavours, textures, and usage occasions. Although findings are confidential, the research offered crucial insights into flavour acceptance, segment-level differences, and potential gaps in the current product lineup. These insights help guide new flavour launches and category expansion strategies.
Case Study.tags: ice cream bars, FMCG, France, usage behaviour, concept testing, online survey, consumer insights, quantitative
Case Study.business_impact: Supports flavour innovation, improves targeting for new product launches, and informs strategic market expansion for the ice cream category.

Case Study.study_objective: To understand the attitude of women toward weight management.
Case Study.summary: This qualitative study explored women’s attitudes toward food, eating habits, and lifestyle choices related to weight management across five major Indian metros. Conducted through face-to-face interviews and Central Location Tests, the research focused on females aged 25 to 55. Respondents shared views on calorie awareness, fat content evaluation, and how health consciousness influences purchasing decisions. Findings indicate that women increasingly prioritize healthier choices, showing a shift toward mindful eating and nutritional awareness. The study offers a strong understanding of evolving needs and motivations among Indian women as they manage diet and overall wellness.
Case Study.tags: weight management, women health, FMCG, qualitative study, lifestyle attitudes, CLT, food choices, F2F, India
Case Study.business_impact: Helps brands tailor communication, develop healthier product variants, and align offerings with growing consumer focus on calorie and fat awareness.

Case Study.geography: UK, France, Germany, Spain, China, South Korea, Japan
Case Study.study_objective: To understand brand salience and coffee consumption habits across multiple global markets.
Case Study.summary: This large-scale study assessed coffee brand salience across Europe and Asia through online surveys among coffee drinkers. It explored brand awareness, usage patterns, and differences in consumption behaviour across ethnicities and regions. The study also compared regular and oversample segments, highlighting variations in incidence rates. While fieldwork progressed smoothly in most markets, China required adjustments due to lower response among younger groups. The findings offer deep insight into market differences, brand recognition levels, and drivers of coffee consumption across seven countries.
Case Study.tags: coffee market, brand salience, FMCG, multicountry study, coffee consumption, online survey, global insights, quantitative
Case Study.business_impact: Enables global strategy development by highlighting cross-market differences, guiding brand positioning, and supporting market prioritization across regions.

Case Study.study_objective: To assess consumer usage, attitudes, and perceptions toward packaged nuts in India.
Case Study.summary: This mixed-method study explored the packaged nuts market across metro and Tier 1 cities in India. A sample of 1400 middle- and high-income consumers participated in a 25 to 30 minute survey complemented by qualitative elements. The research examined usage frequency, attitudes toward packaged nuts, brand awareness, and category perceptions. Results showed that Nataraj and Happilo achieved the strongest top-of-mind recall and highest purchase intention. The study also captured preferences for health, convenience, and packaging formats, helping identify growth opportunities for brands entering or expanding in the Indian packaged nuts segment.
Case Study.tags: packaged nuts, FMCG, India, consumer attitudes, market trends, mixed-method, brand awareness
Case Study.business_impact: Supports category expansion, helps refine brand strategy, and guides product portfolio decisions for companies entering the Indian nuts market.

Case Study.study_objective: To assess the performance and acceptance of three skincare products developed for the Indian market.
Case Study.summary: This quantitative face-to-face study evaluated three new skincare products among regular users across Bangalore, Delhi, Kolkata, and Mumbai. With 150 respondents per category, the research assessed product performance, user habits, category engagement, and comparisons with popular brands. Respondents provided feedback on specific parameters, including efficacy, texture, scent, and overall satisfaction. Insights enabled a clear understanding of consumer expectations, competitive gaps, and product viability. The findings helped the client refine launch plans and make informed decisions regarding category positioning and communication strategy.
Case Study.tags: skincare, FMCG, product placement, India, consumer feedback, quantitative, F2F
Case Study.business_impact: Supports launch strategy, improves product positioning, and guides data-backed decisions on category readiness and competitive differentiation.

Case Study.study_objective: Gauge consumer acceptance and taste preferences for the flagship chocolate product.
Case Study.summary: This study evaluates how consumers in Delhi, Mumbai, and Bangalore perceive the client’s flagship Choco Pie product. Using a Central Location Test, respondents assessed taste, texture, sweetness, packaging, and satisfaction. Results show high acceptance, with over 80% reporting strong satisfaction, especially driven by sweetness and texture. Regional variations emerged, Mumbai and Bangalore consumers favoured a sweeter profile, while Delhi preferred balanced sweetness. The insights highlight consumer expectations, sensory drivers, and packaging appeal that can guide product development and refinements.
Case Study.tags: sensory research, chocolates, FMCG, consumer insights, product testing, CLT, taste evaluation, quantitative, India
Case Study.business_impact: Provides insights to refine product formulation, optimise sensory attributes, and strengthen marketing and product development strategies.

Case Study.study_objective: To understand consumer preferences toward a new chocolate versus existing products.
Case Study.summary: This study evaluated consumer reactions to a new chocolate variant through Focus Group Discussions and a large Computer-Assisted Personal Interviewing exercise across Delhi and Mumbai. Respondents assessed taste, bitterness, cocoa intensity, and overall appeal. Findings showed that the new chocolate was not widely accepted due to its strong bitter taste and high cocoa content. However, a niche group that prefers high-cocoa chocolates responded positively. The research highlights clear taste divides and helps identify the right target audience, guiding product refinement, flavour balancing, and positioning strategies.
Case Study.tags: chocolate testing, taste preference, FMCG, consumer preferences, FGD, CAPI, product evaluation, mixed methodology, India
Case Study.business_impact: Helps determine optimal flavour direction, target niche segments, and refine product strategy based on taste acceptance and cocoa tolerance.

Case Study.study_objective: To size the market and understand usage, frequency, and concept receptiveness for canned vegetables.
Case Study.summary: This study investigates the canned vegetables market in the UK using an online quantitative survey among grocery shoppers who purchased canned vegetables in the past six months. It assesses category usage, frequency of consumption, concept appeal, and purchase intention for new product variants. The research also identifies consumer preferences across segments and evaluates which concepts resonate most. Challenges included weighting data to multiple household compositions and social classes. The insights support sizing the market opportunity and understanding how new canned vegetable offerings can fit into consumer routines.
Case Study.tags: canned vegetables, FMCG, UK, usage frequency, concept testing, online survey, consumer insights, quantitative
Case Study.business_impact: Helps size market potential, refine product concepts, and identify high-opportunity consumer segments for launch and communication.

Case Study.study_objective: Understand perceptions, motivations, barriers, and purchase behaviour toward sustainable fashion.
Case Study.summary: This study examines how Gen Z and Millennial shoppers in India perceive sustainable fashion, exploring their motivations, engagement, purchase triggers, barriers, sustainability awareness, brand expectations, channel preferences, and willingness to pay. It highlights how environmental concerns, ethics, and transparency shape decisions, while identifying gaps between intent and real behaviour, helping brands refine positioning, messaging, assortment, and pricing strategies.
Case Study.tags: sustainable fashion, shopper insights, India, Gen Z, Millennials, fashion retail, consumer behavior, mixed methodology, FGD
Case Study.business_impact: Enables brands to refine sustainability communication, improve targeting, and optimize assortment and pricing strategies to align with emerging consumer expectations.

Case Study.study_objective: To measure campaign impact on awareness, recall, perception, and buying intention.
Case Study.summary: This study evaluates the effectiveness of a chocolate brand’s ad campaign across India using an online quantitative survey among consumers. It examines top-of-mind recall, spontaneous and total awareness, brand consideration, future buying intention, brand perceptions, message recall, and key elements that resonated with the audience. Findings show strong ad reach, with higher exposure frequency positively influencing brand associations. The insights help determine how well the campaign stood out amidst category clutter and its contribution to brand salience.
Case Study.tags: ad effectiveness, brand recall, FMCG, chocolate category, online survey, India, campaign evaluation, quantitative
Case Study.business_impact: Helps assess the campaign’s impact on brand salience, informs creative optimization, and improves future media planning and targeting.

Case Study.study_objective: To understand the brand perception and usage of lighters.
Case Study.summary: This study explores how consumers across Chennai, Delhi, Kolkata, and Mumbai perceive and use cigarette and kitchen lighters. Using face-to-face interviews, the research assesses brand recall, awareness, user behaviour, and reasons for brand choice. Results show that usage is significantly higher among heavy smokers and SEC A consumers, with strong recall for premium as well as local brands. Convenience, smooth usage, style, and value for money emerge as key decision drivers. The study also identifies market fragmentation and differing preferences between heavy smokers and general users, providing clear direction for brand positioning and communication.
Case Study.tags: brand perception, lighters, FMCG, smokers, consumer behavior, product usage, India, quantitative, F2F
Case Study.business_impact: Helps refine positioning, improve recall strategies, and target heavy users effectively while addressing convenience and value-driven needs.

Case Study.study_objective: To understand consumer behaviour and preferences toward health & wellness products in urban and suburban areas.
Case Study.summary: This mixed-method study explored health and wellness shopping behaviour across New York City and Stamford. Surveys captured product preferences, purchase motivations, and shopping habits, while in-depth interviews explored deeper attitudes. Results show that urban shoppers prioritize convenience and product variety, while suburban consumers focus more on quality, health benefits, and natural/organic options. Store interception and random sampling ensured demographic diversity. Key challenges included reaching older age groups and maintaining engagement during long interviews. Insights offer a clear understanding of how geography and lifestyle shape health and wellness purchase decisions.
Case Study.tags: health & wellness, shopper insights, USA, FMCG, mixed-method, consumer behavior, in-depth interview, qualitative
Case Study.business_impact: Helps brands refine targeting, optimize product placement, and tailor marketing strategies based on distinct urban and suburban shopper behaviours.

Case Study.study_objective: To evaluate consumer experience, effectiveness, and satisfaction with the Neem Acne Stick Mask.
Case Study.summary: This mixed-method product placement study assessed the real-world performance of a Neem Acne Stick Mask across four Indian metros. Women aged 15 to 39 used the product twice weekly and provided detailed feedback through structured interviews. Respondents evaluated effectiveness in reducing acne, blackheads, and improving skin texture while also rating ease of application, drying time, and overall satisfaction. The study revealed strong acceptance, with 85% reporting positive experiences and high purchase interest. It also highlighted improvement areas such as hydration, packaging precision, and faster drying time, offering strategic insights for product refinement and market positioning.
Case Study.tags: acne care, skincare, FMCG, product placement, qualitative, consumer insights, India, F2F, neem mask
Case Study.business_impact: Supports product optimization, strengthens market positioning, and guides go-to-market strategies based on real consumer usage and satisfaction levels.
